clinical_study.brief_title: Functional Study to Investigate the Efficacy of a New Medical Device (Modified Diprobase Formulation)
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Controlled, Observer-blinded, Intra-individual Clinical Trial to Examine the Efficacy and Safety of a New Medical Device (Modified Diprobase Formulation) in Adults With Quiescent Atopic Dermatitis

brief_summary.textblock: This clinical trial is intended to investigate the efficacy and safety of a medical device compared to untreated on patients with quiescent atopic dermatitis.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC of the skin hydration assessed of treatment with the test product compared to untreated

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of the short term skin hydration
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of the test product to untreated

secondary_outcome.measure: Skin hydration by measuring skin capacitance assessed by Corneometry (unit: a.u.)
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of the test product to untreated based on differences to Baseline as well as the comparison to Baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Skin hydration after treatment by measuring skin capacitance assessed by Corneometry (unit: a.u.)

secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of the test product to untreated based on the differences to Baseline
Comparison of the test product to untreated based on differences to Baseline for SDS (Sodium dodecyl sulfate) unchallenged and SDS challenged skin
